findings.title: #1 Dangerous usage of `block.timestamp` (timestamp)
findings.description: DPassive.delegateBySig function uses timestamp for comparisons

findings.title: #2 Dangerous strict equalities (incorrect-equality)
findings.description: Usage of strict equality operators can lead to unexpected behavior due to possible differences in data types or precision.

findings.title: #1 Is not in UPPER_CASE_WITH_UNDERSCORES
findings.description: DPassive.totalSupply variable name does not follow the naming convention of being in upper case with underscores.

findings.title: #2 Uses inline ASM
findings.description: The contract uses inline assembly which can increase the risk of vulnerabilities and make the code harder to understand.

findings.title: #3 Uses literals with too many digits
findings.description: Using literals with excessive digits can lead to precision loss or incorrect calculations.
